result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order signed by Judge J. Arthur Melvin III on 10/12/2022.

8:29 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Peter Tempels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Michael Paul Jakus in court for Luis A Burgos Hernandez. 
Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody. 
Defense requests that the case be set on the trial calendar.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 31, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Paul Jakus in court for Luis A Burgos Hernandez.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Paul Jakus appeared by Zoom for Luis A Burgos Hernandez.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court notes the preliminary hearing waiver was not filed 48 hours in advance of today's hearing.  Attorney Jakus is willing to waive time limits and adjourn this matter to allow for him to appear in person.  The Court will set this matter for a waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
appointing Attorney Michael Jakus
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:06 PM Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defendant is requesting the attorney he previously had be appointed to this new case.  Attorney Herbers states they will reach out to this counsel to appoint.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 07-30-2022 re: cash bail entry on CCAP;  
**clerk confirmed CCAP entries indicate $10,000.00 cash bond set on 07-27-2022;  unsure where defendant was notified of incorrect cash bond amount.  Copy of CCAP entry forwarded to the defendant at the Waukesha County Jail via interoffice mail on 08-02-2022 (mjs)
Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:54 PM Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for a Status of Counsel.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Defendant states he was seen by the SPD and they stated he does qualify.
The Court will toll the time limits for setting a prelim hearing and will adjourn.
The Court orders the SPD to put the Defendant on the list to be evaluated for tomorrow.  Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis A Burgos Hernandez
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 07-27-2022)
Prior: 424 Jackson Ct,#2, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (or Victim A's children)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

02:49 PM Defendant Luis A Burgos Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court extends the appointment of Attorney Michael Jakus from cases 22CM305 and 22CT412 to this case.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets matter for status of counsel date so Atty Jakus may be notified and a preliminary hearing date may be set.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
